center.h4: Apart We Stand Together Campaign from TEA and State of Texas

div.p: Each day, updates from Governor Abbott and the Texas Education Agency will be posted to keep you up to date on what is happening with COVID-19 in the State and ways that you can help keep your family and friends safe

div.h4: ALL MEETINGS, PERFORMANCES, PRACTICES, AND GAMES ARE POSTPONED UNTIL SCHOOL IS BACK IN SESSION.

span.strong: For information on The Corona Virus,

div.p: The contents of the District website are copyrighted. No text, image, or other materials on the District's website may be copied or modified without the express written consent of the District.

This Web site may contain links to third party Web sites that are not controlled by LCMCISD. Third party links are available to you as a convenience, and you agree to use these links at your own risk. Please be aware that LCMCISD is not responsible for the content of third party Web sites linked to the District website, nor are we responsible for the privacy policy or practices of third party Web sites linked to the LCMCISD website. We strongly encourage you to review and become familiar with that Web site's privacy policy if you should link to a third party Web site from the LCMCISD website.
LCMCISD is an Equal Opportunity Employer who fully and actively supports Equal Access for all people regardless of Race, Color, Religion, Sex, Age, National Origin or Disability.
